definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
record of famous men/anthology of biographies

sentences.english: China has been no exception to the world-wide celebrity of Susan Boyle.
sentences.chinese: 世界名人蘇姍波義耳對中國也不例外。

sentences.english: Or, at least some prominent figures think so.
sentences.chinese: 至少某些知名人士是這樣認爲的。

sentences.english: TV host Yang Lan is one of China's biggest celebs.
sentences.chinese: 電視主持人楊瀾是中國的名人之一。

sentences.english: GIFs serve as a window into US celebrity culture.
sentences.chinese: 動圖還成了觀察美國名人文化的窗口。

sentences.english: Sure, I've picked up a lot of famous people.
You can go from pick one to 30 and find a Hall of Famer.
sentences.chinese: 從排名第一到30，都有可能是未來的名人堂成員。

sentences.english: Shigeo Tokuda is a very famous celebrity in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 德田重男是一位紅透半邊天的日本名人。
回頭他就表演套名人模仿秀。

sentences.english: We have celebrity clientele, you know.
You got a celebrity world, big figures on TV. But it is false.
sentences.chinese: 一個就是名人的世界，電視上的大腕，但那都是假的。

sentences.english: Member of China Korea Japan culture exchange association.
sentences.chinese: 中國名人文化藝術交流中心常務理事。

sentences.english: On Meeting the Celebrated I have always wondered at the passion many people have to meet the celebrated.
sentences.chinese: 論見名人許多人熱衷於見名人，我始終不得其解。

sentences.english: On Meeting the Celebrated I have always wondered at the passion many people have to meet the celebrated.
sentences.chinese: 論見名人許多人熱衷於見名人，我始終不得其解。

sentences.english: Don't be overawed by authorities and big names.
sentences.chinese: 不要被權威名人所嚇倒。

sentences.english: I will change my perspective towards the personal care product due to the behavior of celebrity endorser.
sentences.chinese: 名人代言人的行爲會影響我對該個人護理產品的看法。

sentences.english: There will be no celebrities or any guests in the commentary box during the game.
sentences.chinese: 比賽中也不會有名人或者任何嘉賓出現在評論席。

definition: the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
